datafield.subfield: The guilt of forbearing to deliver our British colonial slaves. :

A sermon preached at the Parish church of Cheltenham, Gloucestershire on Wednesday, October 7th, at the Parish Church of St. Mary, Islington on Wednesday, October 28th, and at St. John's Chapel, Bedford Row, London, on Sunday, October 31, 1830. /
Boston Public Library (Rare Books Department) ex libris (inscription): C.W. Denison.

Bound volume includes: 1. A Review of the report of a select committee of the house of Commons, on the state of the West India colonies -- 2. Three months in Jamaica, in 1832 -- 3. The West India question -- 4. The guilt of forbearing to deliver our British colonial slaves -- 5. A review of some of the arguments which are commonly advanced against parliamentary interference ... -- 6. The slave colonies of Great Britain -- 7. Negro slavery -- 8. [removed] -- 9. A short review of the slave trade and slavery -- 10. Review of the last session of Parliament (Anti-slavery monthly reporter (for August, 1828)) -- 11. Review of the last session of Parliament ... {Anti-slavery monthly reporter (for September, 1828)) -- 12. The West Indian manifesto examined {Anti-slavery monthly reporter (June 25, 1831)).
